GeodesicProj.cpp

00001 /**
00002  * \file GeodesicProj.cpp
00003  * \brief Command line utility for geodesic projections
00004  *
00005  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2009, 2010, 2011) <charles@karney.com>
00006  * and licensed under the MIT/X11 License.  For more information, see
00007  * http://geographiclib.sourceforge.net/
00008  *
00009  * Compile with -I../include and link with Geodesic.o GeodesicLine.o
00010  * AzimuthalEquidistant.o Gnomonic.o CassiniSoldner.o
00011  *
00012  * See the <a href="GeodesicProj.1.html">man page</a> for usage
00013  * information.
00014  **********************************************************************/
00015 
00016 #include <iostream>
00017 #include <sstream>
00018 #include <string>
00019 #include <sstream>
00020 #include <fstream>
00021 #include <GeographicLib/Geodesic.hpp>
00022 #include <GeographicLib/AzimuthalEquidistant.hpp>
00023 #include <GeographicLib/CassiniSoldner.hpp>
00024 #include <GeographicLib/Gnomonic.hpp>
00025 #include <GeographicLib/DMS.hpp>
00026 #include <GeographicLib/Utility.hpp>
00027 
00028 #include "GeodesicProj.usage"
00029 
00030 int main(int argc, char* argv[]) {
00031   try {
00032     using namespace GeographicLib;
00033     typedef Math::real real;
00034     bool azimuthal = false, cassini = false, gnomonic = false, reverse = false;
00035     real lat0 = 0, lon0 = 0;
00036     real
00037       a = Constants::WGS84_a<real>(),
00038       f = Constants::WGS84_f<real>();
00039     std::string istring, ifile, ofile;
00040 
00041     for (int m = 1; m < argc; ++m) {
00042       std::string arg(argv[m]);
00043       if (arg == "-r")
00044         reverse = true;
00045       else if (arg == "-c" || arg == "-z" || arg == "-g") {
00046         cassini = arg == "-c";
00047         azimuthal = arg == "-z";
00048         gnomonic = arg == "-g";
00049         if (m + 2 >= argc) return usage(1, true);
00050         try {
00051           DMS::DecodeLatLon(std::string(argv[m + 1]), std::string(argv[m + 2]),
00052                             lat0, lon0);
00053         }
00054         catch (const std::exception& e) {
00055           std::cerr << "Error decoding arguments of " << arg << ": "
00056                     << e.what() << "\n";
00057           return 1;
00058         }
00059         m += 2;
00060       } else if (arg == "-e") {
00061         if (m + 2 >= argc) return usage(1, true);
00062         try {
00063           a = Utility::num<real>(std::string(argv[m + 1]));
00064           f = Utility::fract<real>(std::string(argv[m + 2]));
00065         }
00066         catch (const std::exception& e) {
00067           std::cerr << "Error decoding arguments of -e: " << e.what() << "\n";
00068           return 1;
00069         }
00070         m += 2;
00071       } else if (arg == "--input-string") {
00072         if (++m == argc) return usage(1, true);
00073         istring = argv[m];
00074       } else if (arg == "--input-file") {
00075         if (++m == argc) return usage(1, true);
00076         ifile = argv[m];
00077       } else if (arg == "--output-file") {
00078         if (++m == argc) return usage(1, true);
00079         ofile = argv[m];
00080       } else if (arg == "--version") {
00081         std::cout
00082           << argv[0]
00083           << ": $Id: a0e352d6ad04efa43749755044a9beba95b4dad3 $\n"
00084           << "GeographicLib version " << GEOGRAPHICLIB_VERSION_STRING << "\n";
00085         return 0;
00086       } else
00087         return usage(!(arg == "-h" || arg == "--help"), arg != "--help");
00088     }
00089 
00090     if (!ifile.empty() && !istring.empty()) {
00091       std::cerr << "Cannot specify --input-string and --input-file together\n";
00092       return 1;
00093     }
00094     if (ifile == "-") ifile.clear();
00095     std::ifstream infile;
00096     std::istringstream instring;
00097     if (!ifile.empty()) {
00098       infile.open(ifile.c_str());
00099       if (!infile.is_open()) {
00100         std::cerr << "Cannot open " << ifile << " for reading\n";
00101         return 1;
00102       }
00103     } else if (!istring.empty()) {
00104       std::string::size_type m = 0;
00105       while (true) {
00106         m = istring.find(';', m);
00107         if (m == std::string::npos)
00108           break;
00109         istring[m] = '\n';
00110       }
00111       instring.str(istring);
00112     }
00113     std::istream* input = !ifile.empty() ? &infile :
00114       (!istring.empty() ? &instring : &std::cin);
00115 
00116     std::ofstream outfile;
00117     if (ofile == "-") ofile.clear();
00118     if (!ofile.empty()) {
00119       outfile.open(ofile.c_str());
00120       if (!outfile.is_open()) {
00121         std::cerr << "Cannot open " << ofile << " for writing\n";
00122         return 1;
00123       }
00124     }
00125     std::ostream* output = !ofile.empty() ? &outfile : &std::cout;
00126 
00127     if (!(azimuthal || cassini || gnomonic)) {
00128       std::cerr << "Must specify \"-z lat0 lon0\" or "
00129                 << "\"-c lat0 lon0\" or \"-g lat0 lon0\"\n";
00130       return 1;
00131     }
00132 
00133     const Geodesic geod(a, f);
00134     const CassiniSoldner cs = cassini ?
00135       CassiniSoldner(lat0, lon0, geod) : CassiniSoldner(geod);
00136     const AzimuthalEquidistant az(geod);
00137     const Gnomonic gn(geod);
00138 
00139     std::string s;
00140     int retval = 0;
00141     std::cout << std::fixed;
00142     while (std::getline(*input, s)) {
00143       try {
00144         std::istringstream str(s);
00145         real lat, lon, x, y, azi, rk;
00146         std::string stra, strb;
00147         if (!(str >> stra >> strb))
00148           throw GeographicErr("Incomplete input: " + s);
00149         if (reverse) {
00150           x = Utility::num<real>(stra);
00151           y = Utility::num<real>(strb);
00152         } else
00153           DMS::DecodeLatLon(stra, strb, lat, lon);
00154         std::string strc;
00155         if (str >> strc)
00156           throw GeographicErr("Extraneous input: " + strc);
00157         if (reverse) {
00158           if (cassini)
00159             cs.Reverse(x, y, lat, lon, azi, rk);
00160           else if (azimuthal)
00161             az.Reverse(lat0, lon0, x, y, lat, lon, azi, rk);
00162           else
00163             gn.Reverse(lat0, lon0, x, y, lat, lon, azi, rk);
00164           *output << Utility::str<real>(lat, 15) << " "
00165                   << Utility::str<real>(lon, 15) << " "
00166                   << Utility::str<real>(azi, 15) << " "
00167                   << Utility::str<real>(rk, 16) << "\n";
00168         } else {
00169           if (cassini)
00170             cs.Forward(lat, lon, x, y, azi, rk);
00171           else if (azimuthal)
00172             az.Forward(lat0, lon0, lat, lon, x, y, azi, rk);
00173           else
00174             gn.Forward(lat0, lon0, lat, lon, x, y, azi, rk);
00175           *output << Utility::str<real>(x, 10) << " "
00176                   << Utility::str<real>(y, 10) << " "
00177                   << Utility::str<real>(azi, 15) << " "
00178                   << Utility::str<real>(rk, 16) << "\n";
00179         }
00180       }
00181       catch (const std::exception& e) {
00182         *output << "ERROR: " << e.what() << "\n";
00183         retval = 1;
00184       }
00185     }
00186     return retval;
00187   }
00188   catch (const std::exception& e) {
00189     std::cerr << "Caught exception: " << e.what() << "\n";
00190     return 1;
00191   }
00192   catch (...) {
00193     std::cerr << "Caught unknown exception\n";
00194     return 1;
00195   }
00196 }
